sentence.Network_en: A disunited nation has to incur unduly high costs of government.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个分裂的国家必须担负起过度高昂的政府费用.

sentence.Network_en: The issue disunited the party members.
sentence.Network_cn: 该问题在党员中造成分裂.

list.abs: you are wretched , disunited individuals .你们糟透了，分崩离析了。
a disunited nation has to incur unduly high costs of government .一个分裂的国家必须担负起过度高昂的政府费用。
the greatest danger in those cold-war years was to show the Soviet enemy a soft , disunited front .冷战岁月中最大的危险，是向劲敌苏联暴露出软弱分裂的一面。
If a nation is essentially disunited ,, 如果一个国家实际上处于分裂状态,

entry.tran: 不统一的;不和的;有纷争的
entry.def: If a group of people are disunited, there is disagreement and division among them.

example.tran: 一个分歧越来越大的政党

means.word_mean: 1. having been divided; having the unity destroyed;

sentences.sentence: "Congress...gave the impression of...a confusing sum of disconnected local forces"-Samuel Lubell
